bug.author: Nicky-V
bug.summary: Load the recorded with cv2.VideoWrited video
bug.description: My object detection application has a field where the user inserts a link to the video and then the network detects the objects and should return the already processed video with objects and frames. With the help of OpenCV I get video, use the neural network and re-record video with the help of VideoWriter. But when I return the video recorded with the help of VideoWriter I get only a black square instead of video. I have tried different videos smaller than 50 megabytes. What may be the problem ?

comments.comment: The problem seems to be the wrong FOURCC. Who can tell which FOURCC to use to display the video in your browser ?
How did you fix this?, I'm having the exact same issue! <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Nicky-V>@Nicky-V</denchmark-link>
My solution is not perfect, but I use ffmpeg and re-record the video in a different way. os.system("ffmpeg -i docker/app/images/result.mp4 -vcodec libx264 docker/app/images/result_detection.mp4")
